a "NVIDIA X SERVER SETTINGS" GUI tool for Linux is also provided (identical to the GUI tool in windows)

Gets stuck in "Additional Drivers" tab, stating that a manual driver is in use and unable to select another driver to install.

To get NVidia drivers installed and working on KUbuntu 20.10, I went to terminal...

sudo ubuntu-drivers autoinstall

Then restarted machine and all worked well.

Connect your machine using an Ethernet cable directly to your router.

This is surely because your wi-fi adapter is missing an adequate driver to work properly.

In other words. don't do his install using wi-fi.

It will also install the appropriate driver for your wi-fi adapter.

description: Just installed this on my new Ubuntu-20.04 desktop. It installed cleanly and runs perfectly. It allowed me to install the NVIDIA drivers I was missing from the Ubuntu install. I tried to install and select the NVIDIA drivers with the CLI and with the built in apps with no luck. This app worked!

all, for those having issues launching this (under Kubuntu), the laucher requires lxqt-sudo (graphical sudo) which doesn't appear to be installed by default so you will need to install it unfortunately:
sudo apt install lxqt-sudo

[German - for English see below]
Die Oberfläche zum verwalten von zusätzlichen Treibern (3rd-party) funktioniert, wenn man sie über die
 - KDE Einstellungen startet:
  Systemseinstellungen -> Treiberverwaltung -> [Treiberverwaltung neu starten]: Tab "Additional Drivers",
 oder per
- Kommandozeile startet:
 sudo software-properties-qt --open-tab=4

Ein Start über die Aktualisierungsanwendung (Discover) funktioniert jedoch nicht.

[English]
The UI to manage additional drivers (3rd-party) works, if it is startet via:
- KDE Settings:
 System Settings -> Driver Manager -> [Restart Driver Management]: Tab "Addtional Drivers"
 or 
- command line:
 sudo software-properties-qt --open-tab=4

A click on the [start] button in the update application (Discover) doesn`t work however.
